block_comment: This block of Verilog code functions to set up a positive edge triggered flip-flop that stores the state of the "wb_start_read" signal on the rising edge of the "i_clk" signal. It uses a non-blocking assignment (<=) inside an "always" block that triggers on each positive edge of "i_clk", ensuring that the assignment takes place synchronously with the reference clock and preserving signal integrity throughout the design.
